718610f-a.text:
Chambers Street, north side, east from but not including Church
Street.
March 26, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
718610f-a.folder: Chambers Street & Church Street, Manhattan, NY

718612f-a.text:
Chambers Street, west from a point riidway between Church Street and West Broadway (Ninth Avenue "El" thereupon) and across the latter to West Street. Buildings on the right are on the north side of this thoroughfare, at the N.E. and N.W. corners of which at West Broadway,are the Cosmopolitan Hotel and the 10 story Irving Building. Opposite the latter at the left is the 14 story Gerken Building, occupying a site at the S.W.. corner. Note the cobblestone pavement and the surface car track. Exclusive of the absence of same, this thoroughfare is identical in 1939.
April 1, 1928
P. L. Sperr
718612f-a.folder: Chambers Street & Church Street, Manhattan, NY

718611f-a.text:
Chambers Street (left), -ast from and across Chuurch S-rrat to show office buildings at the S.W. and N.W. corners of Broadway obscuring a view of the Municipal Building. These structures are respectively the Broadway 9hambers and the new No. 270 'roadway Building. To the right apnears the Pulitzer "World" doms. The photographer's vantage point is No. 9O West Broadway.
February 11, 1931.
P.L. Sperr

718876f-a.text:
(1)
Church Street, east side, north from and including Chambers
Street.
March 20, 1932..
P. L. Sperr.
The two buildings, No. 99 Chambers and No. 83 Reade Streets, wh ose sides form the east side of Church Street, from Chambers to Reade will
be demolished (September 1937).
(2)
Church Street,East side at Chambers Street lookin south on Church Street and showing the Marine Midland Trust Company
building.
P.L.Sperr,  May 4th,1941.
No Reproductions.
